Description: Pottery jar or of Nile silt clay with flat base, flaring sides, square rim and thick walls, combed or ‘rippled’ horizontally across the exterior body and perpendicularly on the rim top. The exterior is coated with red slip and roughly burnished. The interior lip is slipped, but rest of interior is roughly scraped to finish.
Curator's comments: Miscellaneous class MS2 in Brunton and Caton Thomspon 1928.
Bibliographic references: Brunton & Caton-Thompson 1928 / The Badarian Civilisation and Predynastic Remains near Badari (6, 22; pl. xi.2; xvi.MS2; xx.15)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
